channel.title: undefined - Dietrich Ayala
channel.description: Internet freedom, the web and Mozilla.

item.title: "RDF API for PHP"
item.description: Neat. Someday will have enough spare cycles to play with this.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: "What is a Knowledge Representation?"
item.description: Thanks to an interesting blog entry by Joshua Allen, I was introduced to KR and KIFLink
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: "RDF Primer... Primer"
item.description: AaronSwartz is writing a quickie introduction to RDF. Super helpful. Has great section headings such as "Making Money with RDF", and "RDF in 5 Minutes" (take that you anti-RDF whiners). Also interspersed with links to external resources.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: "RDF Eye Opener"
item.description:
Great snippet from Eric van der Vlist on XML-DEV:

"RDF and its triples is really lightweight when you have the right tools to manipulate them. I like to think of them as a RDBMS with a variable geometry: each "row" (ie each subject) can have a variable number of columns (properties). It's like a RDBMS which you could populate before having written any schema, that's really very flexible and it's just a matter of using the right tool. When I use such a tool, I have a feeling of RDBMS without its straitjacket :-) ..."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: "Semantic Web How-to"
item.description: Step-by-step instructions showing you how to add your pages to the "semantic web." Basically is how to add RDF to every page, and to your site.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala
